result.execSummary:
The defendant John M. Raymer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
with credit for time administratively suspended.
Concurrent with:
Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months, as is the defendant himself. IID to be installed within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Comply with any driver safety program. 
Complete Driving with Care program and be in compliance. 
Absolute Sobriety.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: MCJ with huber for work and treatment, if defendant qualifies under jail classification system. Jail to begin at the agent's discretion within 30 days.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF536, 14CF710, 14TR2732/2733/2734 called: 11:17am
State appears by ADA C.Minder .  Def appears in person and with Atty Peter Rotter.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  Waiver of Prelim. filed.

14CF710>>  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

State moves to:
14TR2732>>DISMISS
14TR2733>>DISMISS
14TR2734>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE
State also notes agreement that any PAC related to 14CF536 will not be filed.

PLEA: 
14CF536 - Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>GUILTY
14CF710 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held in both files; 3 years probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS>>
14CF536:  9 months MCJ to begin at the discrection of PO but within 30 days of today, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; $1000+CC; 36 month DL rev w/credit; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 36 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Be in compliance w/any drivers safety program, IID order, and revocation orders; Complete driving w/care program and be in full compliance; Absolute sobriety; AODA and any follow up recommended
14CF710:  Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC.

If revoked, defendant has 2 days credit in 14CF710 only

Atty Rotter requests cash bonds of $1000 in 14CF536 and $500 in 14CF710 be returned to poster; State does not object; COURT orders cash posted for bond in each case to be returned to surety.

Status conference on January 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
